article: How to get rid of waste is a great problem for the world today. Waste must be treated so that it does not become a danger to life. _ , in some countries, waste from factories is still poured straight into rivers. People who use the water from one of these rivers often get _ . The water may become so polluted that it _ all the fish in the river. When these rivers finally reaches the _ , it pollutes the ocean. In many countries with sea coasts , human waste is piped directly into the sea without being dealt with. This is not _ . Although the sea itself can break up the waste, beaches _ become polluted. _ scientists suggest people take the waste far out to sea in ships where the wind and waves break it down. In 1989 an international law was passed to _ people putting waste into the sea. It is now against the _ to put anything into the sea nearby. Such rubbish as plastics may not be thrown into the sea anywhere. Other waste may be put into the sea, either 19 or more than 40 kilometers from land, depending on the nature of the materials. The _ of dealing with waste has become so great that several international organizations have been set up to protect the world and control pollution.
